results.title: The Hollywood Revue of 1929
results.brief_description: Hosted by Conrad Nagel and Jack Benny this film features many of the MGM contracted stars and performers in an all-out musical comedy revue staged in Hollywood in 1929. Includes such luminaries as Joan Crawford, Laurel and Hardy, John Gilbert, Norma Shearer, Buster Keaton, and Marie Dressler.

results.title: The Hollywood Palace
results.creator_credit: Zodiac Enterprises, William Harbach and Grey Lockwood
results.brief_description: The Hollywood Palace was a very popular long-running American variety show televised on Saturday nights from 1964-1970. Its success was mainly due to its high profile guests and variety of entertainment offered to its viewers along with the revolving core group of hosts including Sammy Davis Jr, Jimmy Durante, Don Adams, Fred Astaire, Judy Garland and the ever popular Bing Crosby. This video is a special edition of the final show hosted by Crosby which takes a look back at some of the most memorable moments with performances by Nat King Cole (“Unforgettable”), Fred Astaire and Ethel Merman (“Anything goes”), Judy Garland (“Be a clown”), Dean Martin (“Volare”), and many more. It also includes some great comedy sketches by such comedians as Jerry Lewis, Groucho Marx, Don Knots, Jack Benny, Debbie Reynolds, Phyllis Diller and Burns and Allen with some “behind-the-scenes” footage of rehearsals and bloopers by the stars. This is a travel down memory lane. An interesting footnote: the Rolling Stones made their first US TV appearance on the show in 1964. Due to the unique material contained in this program, variations may occur in picture and sound quality.

results.creator_credit: Channel 4, Zoo Nation, Contented Productions, Tom Booth, Felix Harrison and Kate Prince
results.brief_description: In a sleepy laundrette a curious girl follows a mysterious young man through the door of a washing machine and finds another world.

results.title: The Hole = Onibaba [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Kindai Eiga Kyokai, Toho Kabushiki Kaisha, Tokyo Eiga Company, Kazuo Kuwahara, Tamotsu Minato, Hisao Itoya, Setsuo Noto and Kaneto Shindo
results.brief_description: Set in the 16th century at a time of brutal clan warfare, peasants are driven to desperate remedies just to stay alive. If that means killing samurai and flogging their amour, then so be it. The two leading characters - a widow (Nobuko Otowa) and her daughter-in-law (Yitsuko Yoshimura) are engaged in just such a racket. Shindo spares us none of the details: victims are speared, stripped and unceremoniously dumped in the concealed pit that hides the evidence of their crime. A samurai, separated from his troops, stumbles into the lakeside village bizarrely clad in the mask of a demon. He wears it, he says, to protect his handsome features from the ravages of war. Like many before him, he is slain and his mask is purloined and used by the widow to terrify her daughter-in-law, of whose unabashed sexuality she is jealous. But the plan misfires, the mask shrinks and clings to her face and when it has to be forcibly released, it discloses the worst horror of all. Music by Mitsu Hayashi. In Japanese with English Subtitles.

results.title: The Holden Story
results.brief_description: The Holden Story traces the company’s history from its earliest days as a mass producer of harness to the Australian Boer War contingent through to the latest developments in automotive factories which will change the face of tomorrow’s industry. “The Holden Story” is a story of optimism and depression, national pride and international competition. Rated: G

results.title: The Hoffnung vacuum cleaner
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, BBC-TV, John Halas and Derek Lamb
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
A story about a housewife who is sold a musical vacuum cleaner by a door to door salesman and subsequently ascends to the heights of musical fame due to her prowess with this instrument. Unfortunately, her chauvinist husband does not cope well with his wife’s new found career. This film raises issues about male and female roles. Animation by Leslie Drew, music by Frances Chagrin and storyboard by Derek Lamb.

results.title: The Hoffnung symphony orchestra [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, BBC-TV, John Halas and Harold Whitaker
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
A light hearted look at the various instruments of the orchestra, based on the original cartoons of the late Gerard Hoffnung, satirising musical pomposity. The music was composed and conducted by Francis Chagrin, who collaborated with Hoffnung on many occasions.

results.title: The Hoffnung Palm Court Orchestra
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, British Broadcasting Corporation and John Halas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
It is the late 19th century in the lounge of an expensive hotel, where the Palm Court Orchestra is playing to a tea drinking audience. A fire starts and the hotel is soon ablaze, the people flee, but the orchestra plays on. In a series of other situations the orchestra also plays on. Based on a series of cartoon drawings by Gerard Hoffnung.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, British Broadcasting Corporation and John Halas

results.title: The Hoffnung music academy
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, British Broadcasting Corporation and John Halas
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
When the music professor rings his bell for his pupils, we take a trip round his Academy to see the various departments in action, including the piano deparment, folk music, military department and church music. Animated film based on the cartoon drawings of Gerard Hoffnung.
